Function Documentation

int son_edit ( son_t *  h,
const char *  name 
)

Opens a file for editing.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
nameThe name of the file to open
Returns
Less than zero for an error

For variable length data types (SON_DATA and SON_STRING), the data can be modified but the size of the data is fixed. Writing a string that is shorter will work as expected. Writing a string (or data chunk) that is larger than the original will trucate data that doesn't fit.

When a value is edited, the value type must match the function used to edit the value (no conversion is performed). An error (SON_ERR_EDIT_TYPE_MISMATCH) will be set if this is attempted.

const char *  access,
int  value

const char *  access,
const void *  data,
son_size_t  size 
)

Edits a data value.

Parameters

accessThe access string

Returns
Less than zero for an error
